Record.ClassificationPath: Skin and Connective Tissue Diseases/Skin Diseases/Photosensitivity Disorders/Hydroa Vacciniforme
Skin and Connective Tissue Diseases/Skin Diseases/Skin Diseases, Vesiculobullous/Hydroa Vacciniforme
Record.Description: A vesicular and bullous eruption having a tendency to recur in summer during childhood and commonly appearing on sun-exposed skin. The lesions are surrounded by an erythematous zone and resemble a vaccination. (From Dorland, 27th ed)
